default.name: default
default.description: Default triplet extraction prompt with explicit and implicit triplets
default.prompt:
Extract triplets from the following context. Each triplet must be of the form (entity, relationship, value). Rules: - Entities is the subject of a sentence. Do not use pronouns (e.g he, or it) to describe an entity, use the full descriptive name. - Relationships refer  to any characteristic of an entity. Even if a relationship is not explicity mentioned, you must included it. Relationships can be things that entity was involved in, or any descriptive characterisitc of that entity.If an entity is described with multiple characteristics in one go, create seperate triplet entries for each of those characteristics.Example: from the text 'Albert Einstein was a German theoretical physicist best known for developing the theory of relativity.' the triplets are (Albert Einstein, nationality, Germany), (Albert Einstein, occupation, theoretical physicist), (Albert Einstein, best known for, developping the theory of relativity) Given these examples, generate explicit and implicit triplets from the following context. 

 {context}

exp.name: exp
exp.prompt:
Extract triplets from the following context. Each triplet must be of the form (entity, relationship, value). Rules: - Entities is the subject of a sentence. Do not use pronouns (e.g he, or it) to describe an entity, use the full descriptive name. - Relationships refer to any characteristic of an entity. Even if a relationship is not explicity mentioned, you must included it. Relationships can be things that entity was involved in, or any descriptive characterisitc of that entity.If an entity is described with multiple characteristics in one go, create seperate triplet entries for each of those characteristics. Example: from the text 'Albert Einstein was a German theoretical physicist best known for developing the theory of relativity.' the triplets are (Albert Einstein, nationality, Germany), (Albert Einstein, occupation, theoretical physicist), (Albert Einstein, best known for, developping the theory of relativity) For example, from the text 'In 1796, Napoleon commanded a military campaign against the Austrians and their Italian allies in the War of the First Coalition' You would extract: (Napoleon, commanded a military campaign in 1796 against, the Austrians and their Italian allies in the War of the First Coalition), (Napoleon, commanded a military campaign against the Austrians and their Italian allies in the War of the First Coalition, in 1796), (Napoleon, commanded a military campaign against Austrians and Italians, in the war of the first coalition in 1796). 
 Given these examples, generate explicit and implicit triplets from the following context. 
 Rules: 
 - The relationships should be as precise as possible, while not needing external information to look them up. 
 - Do NOT include mutliple (entity, relation) pairs which have different values, in this case the relationship or entity is not precicse enough, you must add more precision. 
 Here is the context: 

 {context}
